HP Mini 110 Netbook ...

I have one of those. I think mine has the N450 CPU, though it's not here to check.
And yes, it's slower than a P4, but likely only because of it's low clock speed. If I had a 1.6Ghz prescott to compare it to, I suspect it would be pretty close.

Hi, welcome on board!

Delta V calculations have just been added to stock on the PC/Mac/Linux version, so there's a hope that it could come to consoles in some future version. I don't have any inside information on that, though.

They've said no to the burn time indicator additions from 1.5 being included, so the good money is no deltaV calculator in the upcoming update. 

 

That's certainly just a guess from me, to be sure.

8 hours ago, Deddly said:

They come out sporadically every couple of weeks, so the only thing we can do is wait, sorry! 

Okay thanks

About a Launchsite on the Mun, Squad could start by revamping the tech tree so you begin with unmanned crafts only, at least in career mode. The untra ending goal of the stock tech tree would be to install a permanent base on the Mun with a launch site of limited capability. That would requite some revamping of the contract system as well as it could become available by both fullfilling a contract and unlocking a tech node. That would make things more interesting than just unlocking tech nodes with science. Science is good but real actions are as well.

Having a suite of mission contracts to set up a base of your design at a certain designated place on the Mun could enable the tech tree to unlock a launchsite.  So for enabling a launch site you'd have to do several missions to fullfill and hadfull of contracts from the Krbin scientific society or something like that.

For Science mode, make it a cheat menu option.

For Sand box, well this is sand box, the mode where you can already do what you want, test things so that's fine.

1 hour ago, Quoniam Kerman said:

About a Launchsite on the Mun, Squad could start by revamping the tech tree so you begin with unmanned crafts only, at least in career mode. The untra ending goal of the stock tech tree would be to install a permanent base on the Mun with a launch site of limited capability. That would requite some revamping of the contract system as well as it could become available by both fullfilling a contract and unlocking a tech node. That would make things more interesting than just unlocking tech nodes with science. Science is good but real actions are as well.

Having a suite of mission contracts to set up a base of your design at a certain designated place on the Mun could enable the tech tree to unlock a launchsite.  So for enabling a launch site you'd have to do several missions to fullfill and hadfull of contracts from the Krbin scientific society or something like that.

For Science mode, make it a cheat menu option.

For Sand box, well this is sand box, the mode where you can already do what you want, test things so that's fine.

I'd love to see that. In order to accomplish this Squad would need to make quite a number of changes. These are the ones I can think of off the top of my head:

  • Rebuild the tech tree
  • Add in new parts for colonization and launch site construction
  • All the parts will either have to be landed or built on site, which would require in situ manufacturing and assembly. You could probably hand-wave this by having a 3D printer part and assume colonists assemble it. Time to build and assemble could be limited by availability of resources and number of colonists present.
  • Fix once and for all the bugs for landed vehicles so your hab doesn't bounce or shimmy or vibrate around on the surface

If they're able to accomplish all that I'd be really excited. This is far cooler than just having a launch pad magically appear on the mun on which craft are magically transported.
